intro: Homoranthus wilhelmii, commonly known as the pink fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
